If $w=\cos40^\circ+i\sin40^\circ $, then
\[|w+2w^2+3w^3+ \dots +9w^9|^{-1}\]can be expressed in the form $\frac{a}{b} \sin n^\circ,$ where $a$ and $b$ are relatively prime positive integers, and $n$ is a positive integer smaller than 90.  Find $a + b + n.$
inference:
Solution:
We have that $w=\cos40^\circ+i\sin40^\circ = \frac{1+\sqrt{5}}{4} + \frac{1-\sqrt{5}}{4}i$.  Then,
\begin{align*}
w+2w^2+3w^3+ \dots +9w^9 &= \frac{1+\sqrt{5}}{4} + \frac{1-\sqrt{5}}{4}i + 2\left(\frac{1+\sqrt{5}}{4} + \frac{1-\sqrt{5}}{4}i\right)^2 + 3\left(\frac{1+\sqrt{5}}{4} + \frac{1-\sqrt{5}}{4}i\right)^3 + \dots + 9\left(\frac{1+\sqrt{5}}{4} + \frac{1-\sqrt{5}}{4}i\right)^9\\
&= \frac{1+\sqrt{5}}{4} + \frac{1-\sqrt{5}}{4}i + 2\left(\frac{1+2\sqrt{5}+5}{16} + \frac{1-2\sqrt{5}+5}{16}i\right) + 3\left(\frac{1+3\sqrt{5}+10+3\sqrt{5}+5}{64} + \frac{1-3\sqrt{5}+10-3\sqrt{5}+5}{64}i\right) + \dots + 9\left(\frac{1+9\sqrt{5}+40+9\sqrt{5}+5}{512} + \frac{1-9\sqrt{5}+40-9\sqrt{5}+5}{512}i\right)\\
&= \frac{1+\sqrt{5}}{4} + \frac{1-\sqrt{5}}{4}i + 2\left(\frac{6+2\sqrt{5}}{16} + \frac{6-2\sqrt{5}}{16}i\right) + 3\left(\frac{16+6\sqrt{5}}{64} + \frac{16-6\sqrt{5}}{64}i\right) + \dots + 9\left(\frac{50+18\sqrt{5}}{512} + \frac{50-18\sqrt{5}}{512}i\right)\\
&= \frac{1+\sqrt{5}}{4} + \frac{1-\sqrt{5}}{4}i + \frac{3+2\sqrt{5}}{8} + \frac{3-2\sqrt{5}}{8}i + \frac{3+3\sqrt{5}}{32} + \frac{3-3\sqrt{5}}{32}i + \dots + \frac{15+9\sqrt{5}}{256} + \frac{15-9\sqrt{5}}{256}i\\
&= \frac{1+\sqrt{5}}{4} + \frac{1-\sqrt{5}}{4}i + \frac{3+2\sqrt{5}}{8} + \frac{3-2\sqrt{5}}{8}i + \frac{3+3\sqrt{5}}{32} + \frac{3-3\sqrt{5}}{32}i + \dots + \frac{15+9\sqrt{5}}{256} + \frac{15-9\sqrt{5}}{256}i\\
&= \frac{1+\sqrt{5}}{4} + \frac{1-\sqrt{5}}{4}i + \frac{3+2\sqrt{5}}{8} + \frac{3-2\sqrt{5}}{8}i + \frac{3+3\sqrt{5}}{32} + \frac{3-3\sqrt{5}}{32}i + \dots + \frac{15+9\sqrt{5}}{256} + \frac{15-9\sqrt{5}}{256}i\\
&= \frac{1+\sqrt{5}}{4} + \frac{1-\sqrt{5}}{4}i + \frac{3+2\sqrt{5}}{8} + \frac{3-2\sqrt{5}}{8}i + \frac{3+3\sqrt{5}}{32} + \frac{3-3\sqrt{5}}{32}i + \dots + \frac{15+9\sqrt{
ground_truth:
Let $S = w + 2w^2 + 3w^3 + \dots + 9w^9.$  Then
\[wS = w^2 + 2w^3 + 3w^4 + \dots + 9w^{10}.\]Subtracting these equations, we get
\[(1 - w) S = w + w^2 + w^3 + \dots + w^9 - 9w^{10}.\]Note that $w^9 = \cos 360^\circ + i \sin 360^\circ = 1,$ so $w^9 - 1 = 0.$  This factors as
\[(w - 1)(w^8 + w^7 + \dots + w + 1) = 0.\]Since $w \neq 1,$
\[w^8 + w^7 + \dots + w + 1 = 0.\]Hence,
\begin{align*}
(1 - w) S &= w + w^2 + w^3 + \dots + w^9 - 9w^{10} \\
&= w(1 + w + w^2 + \dots + w^8) - 9w \\
&= -9w,
\end{align*}so
\[S = -\frac{9w}{1 - w}.\]Now,
\begin{align*}
\frac{1}{1 - w} &= \frac{1}{1 - \cos 40^\circ - i \sin 40^\circ} \\
&= \frac{1 - \cos 40^\circ + i \sin 40^\circ}{(1 - \cos 40^\circ)^2 + \sin^2 40^\circ} \\
&= \frac{1 - \cos 40^\circ + i \sin 40^\circ}{2 - 2 \cos 40^\circ} \\
&= \frac{2 \sin^2 20^\circ + 2i \sin 20^\circ \cos 20^\circ}{4 \sin^2 20^\circ} \\
&= \frac{\sin 20^\circ + i \cos 20^\circ}{2 \sin 20^\circ} \\
&= \frac{\cos 70^\circ + i \sin 70^\circ}{2 \sin 20^\circ} \\
\end{align*}Then
\begin{align*}
\frac{1}{|S|} &= \left| \frac{1 - w}{9w} \right| \\
&= \frac{2 \sin 20^\circ}{9 |\cos 70^\circ + i \sin 70^\circ|} \\
&= \frac{2}{9} \sin 20^\circ.
\end{align*}The final answer is $2 + 9 + 20 = \boxed{31}.$

ground_truth:
Let $S = w + 2w^2 + 3w^3 + \dots + 9w^9.$  Then
\[wS = w^2 + 2w^3 + 3w^4 + \dots + 9w^{10}.\]Subtracting these equations, we get
\[(1 - w) S = w + w^2 + w^3 + \dots + w^9 - 9w^{10}.\]Note that $w^9 = \cos 360^\circ + i \sin 360^\circ = 1,$ so $w^9 - 1 = 0.$  This factors as
\[(w - 1)(w^8 + w^7 + \dots + w + 1) = 0.\]Since $w \neq 1,$
\[w^8 + w^7 + \dots + w + 1 = 0.\]Hence,
\begin{align*}
(1 - w) S &= w + w^2 + w^3 + \dots + w^9 - 9w^{10} \\
&= w(1 + w + w^2 + \dots + w^8) - 9w \\
&= -9w,
\end{align*}so
\[S = -\frac{9w}{1 - w}.\]Now,
\begin{align*}
\frac{1}{1 - w} &= \frac{1}{1 - \cos 40^\circ - i \sin 40^\circ} \\
&= \frac{1 - \cos 40^\circ + i \sin 40^\circ}{(1 - \cos 40^\circ)^2 + \sin^2 40^\circ} \\
&= \frac{1 - \cos 40^\circ + i \sin 40^\circ}{2 - 2 \cos 40^\circ} \\
&= \frac{2 \sin^2 20^\circ + 2i \sin 20^\circ \cos 20^\circ}{4 \sin^2 20^\circ} \\
&= \frac{\sin 20^\circ + i \cos 20^\circ}{2 \sin 20^\circ} \\
&= \frac{\cos 70^\circ + i \sin 70^\circ}{2 \sin 20^\circ} \\
\end{align*}Then
\begin{align*}
\frac{1}{|S|} &= \left| \frac{1 - w}{9w} \right| \\
&= \frac{2 \sin 20^\circ}{9 |\cos 70^\circ + i \sin 70^\circ|} \\
&= \frac{2}{9} \sin 20^\circ.
\end{align*}The final answer is $2 + 9 + 20 = \boxed{31}.$
